   By Tom Kertscher July 15, 2012

GOP Wisconsin Senate candidate Tommy Thompson says he never backed individual
mandate

   Among conservatives, a hated provision of federal health care reform is
   the "individual mandate," which requires Americans (with some exceptions)
   to buy health insurance.

So, Thompson said he supported Massachusetts’ health insurance requirement
   and said such a mandate is "all right," although both statements were made
   before Obama’s reform efforts were launched.

So, after the generally supportive statements in 2006 and 2007, Thompson
   in 2008, shortly before Obama’s election, indicated he did not support an
   individual mandate.
